definitions.title: 2. a.
definitions.body: close in upon ([[בְּעַד]]) Ju Jdg 3:22 (fat upon blade of sword), so poss. also [[וַיִּסְגּׁר בָּשָׂר תַּחְתֶּנׇּה]] Ge 2:21 (J) and flesh closed in, in place of it (usu. and he closed flesh, i.e. closed the gap with flesh); [[עֲלֵיהֶם הַמִּדְבָּר]] ´[[ס]] Ex 14:3 the wilderness hath closed in upon them; obj. om., [[יִסְגּׁר עַל־אִישׁ]] Job 12:14 he closeth in upon a man, fig. of imprisonment.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: close up breach ([[פֶּרֶץ]]) [in wall] of city 1Ki 11:27; poss. close up [path] (si vera 1.) Ps 35:3 Vrss Ol De Bae; JDMich DeW Ew Hup-Now Che take [[סְגׁר]] here as weapon, usu. battle-axe [Gk. sa/gariv] of Massagetae Herod:i. 215 cf. Lag:Ges. Abh. 203, also Egypt. sagartă (loan-word) Bondi:55; both improb., text prob. corrupt; Schwally:ZAW xi (1891), 258 reads [[חֲגׁר]] > Hal:Rev. Sêm. iii (1894), 47 [[עוּרָה]] (cf. Ps 59:5).
Pt. pass., closed up = closely joined with tight seal, Job 41:7 (of scales of crocodile).

elsewhere only Pt. pass. in [[זׇהָב סָגוּר]] (gold shut up, and so prized, rare, fine ?), only of temple adornment and utensils 1Ki 6:20, 1Ki 6:21, 1Ki 7:49, 1Ki 7:50, 1Ki 10:21 = 1Ch 9:20, 1Ch 4:20; 1Ch 4:22; perh. read [[סָגוּר]] (abbrev. for ´[[ס]] ´[[ז]]) Job 28:15 (for MT [[סְגוֹר]], so Hoffm Bu Du): cf. As. ḫurâṣu sakru, Dl:HWB 499.
subj. pers. be shut up [in city] 1Sa 23:7, [[מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה]] Nu 12:14, Nu 12:15 (E); [[בְּתוֹךְ]] [[בַּיִת]] Ez Eze 3:24.
be shut, closed, of city gates Ez Eze 46:2, Is 45:1, Is 60:11 and ([[דלתות]]) Ne 13:19.
